communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Pennsylvania Right to Know Act, I hereby request the following records:

Information related to the July 4, 2025 Food Truck Festival held in Harrisburg, Pennsylvania on Front Street.
- The audio recording and script of any public announcements played during the event, indicating that "bags are subject to search."
- Documentation showing the location and timing of these announcements (e.g., speaker placement, frequency).
- Any communication concerning the development, authorization, and legal justification for the stated bag search policy and prohibition of ski masks or other face coverings during the event.
- Instructions provided to personnel to conduct or justify searches based on suspicion, behavior, or appearance
- Whether and how Community Service Aides (CSAs) were authorized to participate in or conduct searches
- Any official directives, standard operating procedures, briefings, or training documents provided to personnel outlying authority to conduct searches or enforce face covering policies
- Any public facing materials issued before the event, including press releases, city website updates, social media posts, event signage plans and verbiage, informing the public about bag searches, face covering rules, or related enforcement policies
- Any incident repots, enforcement logs, or field notes documenting actual searches or encounters with individuals during the event, include those stopped for wearing face coverings, bags being search, or appearing "suspicious"

Communication includes any internal or external communication (including email, text messages, memos, meeting notes, call logs, city council meeting notes) within and between the following related to the bag search policy and face covering restriction:
- The City of Harrisburg (including the Mayor’s Office, City Council, and all municipal departments)
- The Harrisburg Bureau of Police
- The Pennsylvania State Police (PSP)
- The Dauphin County District Attorney’s Office
- Any Dauphin County government offices
- Any Pennsylvania state government departments or officials
- Any Federal government agencies, law enforcement, or intelligence agency

Provide the requested records electronically if available.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Sebastian Sibrand

To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

- Any and all lists, spreadsheets or other organized datasets that detail potential or substantiated allegations of misconduct and/or impeached or impeachable testimony, created under Brady v. Maryland and/or Giglio v. United States.
- Any and all records regarding substantiated allegations of misconduct or violations of internal department policy or criminal law by specific law enforcement officers.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Dillon Bergin

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: FDA on lecanemab
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

July 15, 2025
Food and Drug Administration
Division of Freedom of Information (HFI-35)

RE:  Freedom of Information Act request

Dear FOIA Officer:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, 5 U.S.C. § 552a, I am requesting all FDA FAERS case  reports, including the narrative and summary reports on the two drugs below:
1.)  lecanemab aka: lecanemab-IRMB or Leqembi  for all times up to the most recent entries.
2.)  donanemab, aka donanemab-AZBT or Kisunla for all times up to the most recent entries.

I'm also requesting case report number 24075739 regarding a patient on lecanemab who experience “confusion”.

I am a professional journalist writing on commission for The BMJ and The Lever.
 
As an investigative journalist, I request a waiver of fees associated with processing this FOIA request and duplicating responsive records.  

Thank you for your attention to this request.

Sincerely,


Jeanne Lenzer

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jeanne Lenzer

title: Incident report for 2023 Lewiston Maine Shootings

communications.subject: Maine Freedom of Access Act Request: Incident report for 2023 Lewiston Maine Shootings
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Maine Freedom of Access Act, I hereby request the following records:

The incident report and any supplements, such as Forensic photography taken in relation to shooting incident(s) inside Lewiston, Maine on 10/25/2023.

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as we believe this request is in the public interest, as suggested but not stipulated by 1 M.R.S.A. § 408(6). The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, and is not made for commercial usage.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jamie Bensley

Date of birth: April 5 1921

Occupation: Medical Doctor, Doctor of Radiology
Institutions:
- Studied at University of California, Los Angeles (UCLA), Los Angeles CA

Spouse: Mildred ("Millie") Jessica Harris (DOB December 15 1920)
Brother: Herbert Allen Kordan (DOB April 10 1926, DOD October 11 2021)

Dawn Kordan

I am also requesting all records including the Prohibited Access Files and files associated with gang stalking, harassment, and direct energy weapons attacks, which I have been a victim of since approximately January 1st, 2021. Since this date I have experienced targeted noise campaigns which have disrupted my life and have caused psychological distress and torture, sensitized me to specific sound, noise, colors, vehicles, etc and have caused me to be controlled and manipulated out of fear. These campaigns have affected me in a long term way. They have also contributed to legal problems which I am currently dealing with.

I have been tortured and my privacy has been completely violated. I have been forced to view profane graphic imagery through augmented reality visualization that bypass my optical eyesight and therefore I had no control over these images as well as constant forced dream sequences and dream manipulation. I request the records that would indicate anyone I have been associated with who has been threatened, coerced, paid or bribed, harassed or lied to in order to cooperate against me or to collaborate against me in smear campaigns or character assassinations against me or strangers and anonymous persons. In short I request any and all records associated with my name and person under the jurisdiction of any and all “Black Lists” Terrorist Screening Databases or “Watch Lists” any list which would expose me to all of the above attacks including microwave attacks, microwave frequency attacks, radiation attacks, etc. 

Please search the FBI’s indices to the central records system for the information responsive to this request related to: All of the above. 



I am willing to pay up to [any amount 
] for the
processing of this request. Please inform me of the estimated fees before processing my request.

I am seeking this information for personal use and not for commercial use. 
Thank you for your consideration and time. 

Moises Covarrubias

US

title: ALPR audit (St. Louis Department Of Public Safety)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the The Missouri Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

1. Organization Audit in Flock.
The report should include data logged from the period of January 1, 2025, to the date this request is processed. Per Flock's documentation, the Organization Audit is available within the Insights tab and is defined as searches done within the agency.

2. Network Audit in Flock.
The report should include data logged from the period of January 1, 2025, to the date this request is processed. Per Flock's documentation, the Network Audit is available within the Insights tab and is defined as searches of the organization’s Flock network by any agency in the Flock System.

3. A list of network share settings that include:
3a. Flock networks shared with me
3b. Networks that I’m sharing

Please provide records in their original electronic, machine readable format. For example, please provide csv or spreadsheet files where applicable.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Scott Kampas

files.title: attachment-1
files.source: Coral Springs Police Department, Coral Springs, FL

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Massachusetts Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records from the Boston Police Department, modified for specificity and reasonable scope in accordance with 950 CMR 32.06 and recent guidance under Chawla and Friedman:

Request Description
We are seeking aggregate-level arrest data for the calendar years 2023-present, limited to incidents that meet all of the following conditions: took place within the City of Boston, and resulted in an arrest initiated by Boston Police Department personnel.

We are requesting the following fields, if available, for each arrest record:
City of Boston Employee ID (6-digit ID)
 Badge Number
Officer First, Middle, Last Name
Officer Rank
Date of arrest (MM/DD/YYYY)
District or task force
Incident number
Location of arrest (block or nearest intersection is sufficient)
Arrestee demographics (race, gender, and age group)
Statute or charge code for arrest
Whether force was used (yes/no)
Whether contraband was found (yes/no), and general type if recorded (e.g., firearm, narcotics)
Whether a search was conducted (yes/no)

We are not requesting:

Any personally identifying information (e.g., names, SSNs, home addresses)
Juvenile records
Sexual assault narratives
Body-worn camera footage or other media
Free-text narrative descriptions

If a structured or tabular dataset already exists that meets these criteria—such as data used for internal reports or dashboards—we are happy to accept that format to reduce staff burden.

If any of these fields are unavailable, please reach out and let us know!

I also request a waiver of all fees for this request, as disclosure of the requested information to me is in the public interest and will contribute to the public’s understanding of operations and activities of the government. This request is being made for research conducted by Spark! at Boston University and will not be used for commercial use.

I expect the request to be filled in an electronically-accessible format, including for screen readers, excel, or CSV. Files that are not accessible to screen readers include, for example, .pdf image files as well as physical documents. We understand that the data may be large in size, so feel free to send it over in year or half-year increments.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires. If you believe any of this information to be exempt, I ask you to please cite the specific portion of the law on which you rely. I also ask you to please redact any information you believe to be exempt and disclose the rest. If you need to discuss this request, I can be reached at 617-358-8514.

Sincerely,
Boston University SPARK!

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Unmask ICE
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I want to know if  ICE employees working in Oregon are local citizens who understand the community in which we live, versus employees based in other parts of the country who do not have an understanding of our community. 

In the public interest we need to know who are the numerous individuals claiming to represent ICE who have been documented (1) wearing masks, (2) refusing to show government-issued identification corroborating their affiliation with ICE, CBP, USCIS, and/or local law enforcement. Furthermore, there have been incredibly concerning instances of (3) non-law enforcement agents dressing as legitimate agents who kidnap or attempt to kidnap residents in our community.

As a natural-born US-citizen, I respectfully submit this request to ensure the safety of the community where I reside, and individuals and communities impacted by these activities.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Joana E Kirchhoff

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Unmask ICE
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I want to know if  ICE employees working in Oregon are local citizens who understand the community in which we live, versus employees based in other parts of the country who do not have an understanding of our community. 

In the public interest we need to know who are the numerous individuals claiming to represent ICE who have been documented (1) wearing masks, (2) refusing to show government-issued identification corroborating their affiliation with ICE, CBP, USCIS, and/or local law enforcement. Furthermore, there have been incredibly concerning instances of (3) non-law enforcement agents dressing as legitimate agents who kidnap or attempt to kidnap residents in our community.

As a natural-born US-citizen, I respectfully submit this request to ensure the safety of the community where I reside, and individuals and communities impacted by these activities.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Joana E Kirchhoff

communications.subject: Email confirmation instructions
communications.communication:
To continue creating your USCIS Account, you must confirm your email address. To confirm your email address, please click on the link below, or copy and paste the entire link into your browser. https://myaccount.uscis.gov/account-creation/confirmation/z5UH_ieB8WPIBumX_Zjt (https://myaccount.uscis.gov/account-creation/confirmation/z5UH_ieB8WPIBumX_Zjt) 
Please note that this confirmation link expires in 24 hours and may require your immediate attention if you wish to access your online account in the future. 
If you require additional assistance logging into your account, please contact us at https://www.uscis.gov/about-us/contact-us. (https://www.uscis.gov/about-us/contact-us) 
 PLEASE DO NOT REPLY TO THIS MESSAGE

communications.subject: Secure two-step verification notification
communications.communication:
You have requested a secure verification code to log into your USCIS Account. 
Please enter this secure verification code: 780850 
If you are not attempting to log into USCIS , please go to https://myaccount.uscis.gov/users/edit to reset your password and review your security settings. (https://myaccount.uscis.gov/users/edit) 
Please be aware that this update might require your immediate attention. 
 PLEASE DO NOT REPLY TO THIS MESSAGE
